The claim originated from an article pub: which focused on the controversy surrounding Cambridge Analytica's collection of Facebook user data.
The original article: which made the headline claim of users receiving $17,500 each, was removed and only available through archived and aggregated versions. The reason for its removal remains unclear.
The claim was specific to UK users and b: s Data Protection Act 1998, which is not applicable in the United States or other countries.
The compensation amount mentioned in the: 12,500 ($17,500), was highly speculative and dependent on users being able to prove distress caused by the data breach. The actual amount of compensation would vary based on the level of distress suffered.
